item.name: German Contract Naval Cutlass
item.description: The cutlass was one of the most common pirate weapons during the Golden Age. The cutlass could not only be used as a weapon, but could also be used as an intimidation tactic and a tool, akin to a modern machete. This particular cutlass was frequently used by privateers, merchants, and especially pirates!

item.name: British Hunting Cutlass
item.description: The cutlass was one of the most common pirate weapons during the Golden Age. The cutlass could not only be used as a weapon, but could also be used as an intimidation tactic and a tool, akin to a modern machete.

item.name: Grenade
item.description: Grenades used during the Golden Age of Piracy were hollow iron spheres stuffed with a wooden fuse plug, through which a fuse, typically a slowmatch or paper fuse, was fed. The fuse was lit and then lobbed onto enemy ships to inflict damage!
